btk.sampling_functions module¶

The sampling_functions modules contains everything related to the SamplingFunction class, including implementations for the WLD and COSMOS catalogs.

class btk.sampling_functions.BasicSamplingFunction(max_number=4, stamp_size=24.0, maxshift=None)¶

Bases: btk.sampling_functions.SamplingFunction

Methods

__call__(table, **kwargs)

Samples galaxies from input catalog to make blend scene.
__init__(max_number=4, stamp_size=24.0, maxshift=None)¶

Class representing sampling functions to sample input catalog from which to draw blends.

Parameters

max_number (int) – maximum number of catalog entries returned from sample.

class btk.sampling_functions.DefaultSampling(max_number=2, stamp_size=24.0, maxshift=None)¶

Bases: btk.sampling_functions.SamplingFunction

Attributes
compatible_catalogs

Methods

__call__(table[, shifts, indexes])

Applies default sampling to the input CatSim-like catalog and returns an astropy table with entries corresponding to a blend centered close to postage stamp center.
__init__(max_number=2, stamp_size=24.0, maxshift=None)¶

Default sampling function used for producing blend tables. :param max_number: Defined in parent class :type max_number: int :param stamp_size: Size of the desired stamp. :type stamp_size: float :param maxshift: Magnitude of maximum value of shift. If None then it

is set as one-tenth the stamp size. (in arcseconds)

property compatible_catalogs¶

class btk.sampling_functions.GroupSamplingFunction(max_number, wld_catalog_name, stamp_size, pixel_scale, shift=None, group_id=None)¶

Bases: btk.sampling_functions.SamplingFunction

Attributes
compatible_catalogs

Methods

__call__(table, **kwargs)

We use self.wld_catalog created above to sample groups, but ultimately returns rows from the input table (by matching the corresponding galaxy ids).
__init__(max_number, wld_catalog_name, stamp_size, pixel_scale, shift=None, group_id=None)¶
Blends are defined from groups of galaxies from the CatSim

catalog previously analyzed with WLD.

Note: the pre-run WLD images are not used here. We only use the pre-run catalog (in i band) to identify galaxies that belong to a group.

Parameters

  • max_number – Same as in SamplingFunction

  • wld_catalog_name – File path to a pre-analyzed WLD Catsim catalog.

property compatible_catalogs¶

class btk.sampling_functions.GroupSamplingFunctionNumbered(max_number, wld_catalog_name, stamp_size, pixel_scale, shift=None, fmt='fits')¶

Bases: btk.sampling_functions.SamplingFunction

Attributes
compatible_catalogs

Methods

__call__(table, **kwargs)

The group is centered on the middle of the postage stamp.
__init__(max_number, wld_catalog_name, stamp_size, pixel_scale, shift=None, fmt='fits')¶

Blends are defined from groups of galaxies from a CatSim-like catalog previously analyzed with WLD.

This function has an extra attribute group_id_count which tracks the group id returned. Each time the generator is called, 1 gets added to the count. If the count is larger than the number of groups input, the generator is forced to exit.

NOTE: the pre-run WLD images are not used here. We only use the pre-run catalog to identify galaxies that belong to a group.

Parameters

  • max_number – Same as SamplingFunction

  • wld_catalog_name – Same as GroupSamplingFunction

property compatible_catalogs¶

!! processed by numpydoc !!
